commentBody: Senator Harris would make a brilliant Vice President.

I really liked Ms. Harris. I hope she'll find a way to support a candidate who's NOT Biden, Sanders or Warren! They're all okay, but, sadly, I don't think they'll beat the White House's current occupant.

For the record, I was and am a fan of Senator Harris.  I'm also glad that she can now use her many strengths to work for the people of California, who are in serious need of her sense and strength.   
Senator Harris could never decide what to focus on, and was apparently unable or unwilling to decide what her core beliefs and strengths were, and clearly present them to the American people..  
She had a meteoric rise in SF and California politics, and was able to navigate the contradictions between being a prosecutor and a "liberal" in Northern CA.  However, none of that translated to the national stage-
She came at everything with prosecutorial zeal in the beginning, but that didn't play well outside the liberal Bay  Area.  Her calculated attack on Biden in the first debate did her more harm than good.  She came across a a cheap-shot artist, playing the victim on the basis of race and gender, while attacking with prosecutorial zeal.  It played badly to the electorate, and she was unable to decide which Kamala she should present to the American people.  It went downhill from there. Her style is familiar to Californians, but gave the national audience a negative impression from the very beginning.
She will be back; she's a star.  Smart, tough, middle of the road ideologically and an interesting racial blend of the  quintessential American for the next decades.  I wish her the best.

Not surprised, if you don't attract support the money dries up. She was an opportunist with no commitment to anything but whatever the latest polls showed. Her story at the debate was obviously a canned response intended to elicit far left applause.
She needed to determine what she stood for and let us know.

A centrist candidate whose positions seemed to vacillate based on short term calculations. We don’t need more of those. 

And that cheap shot she threw at Biden was staged, inauthentic, and unwarranted. I am not a fan of Biden, but he didn’t deserve that and I wrote her off right there. 

Maybe she will mature over the next 4 to 8 years. In the meantime, good riddance.
Harris had liberal guilt on her side but not liberal money.

While Senator Harris is a woman of color, she failed to poll well in South Carolina among black voters.  Black voters are too sophisticated to fall for these artificial boxes created by the political pundits.

A "coveted" 130 CA Bundlers whose total was a mere $25,000? Someone's got to be kidding~! Give us a break. It's peanuts in a race this size of notables. She should have taken what was still offered, followed through w the two upcoming scheduled fund raising events, fired her sister and head staff and went on until at least the Dec. Debate. Iowa doesn't even vote until whenever. A lot will still change as apparently, both she and Gov Bullock's dropping out shows.
userDisplayName: Earth: 4 Billion Years Left To Shed Us

commentBody:
I am very sad to hear this News.  Kamala, as a Senator, has WAY more experience than other "fund-raising" Candidates.
Someone with her grit and her stamina goes far further, Politically, for me, than a two-term marginal "Mayor", even if some "Polls" and on-line fund raising say that he is so "it".

There are far too many distractions in the Democratic Field for Presidency right now.

Senator Harris, you will be greatly missed.
Never have your sister as the campaign lead, nor any other family member.
Harris got far on her gender, race and typical talking points but when people actually saw that she really isn't that great of a human being, it was only a matter of time.

commentBody:
I'm a fan: She has skills, experience, depth, smarts, and likability. She would make a good president, but she's a very good senator, also, so it's not a total loss for America.

Thank you, Ms. Harris, for all you've done and are doing. We need more like you.

All the best!

[{'commentID': 103948214, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103948214, 'userID': 34456491, 'userDisplayName': 'Levon', 'userLocation': 'Left Coast', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': 'I’m not. Her campaign rhetoric, most of it in the form of a lecture, was simply about how awful trump was, and that’s about it, other than when going after Biden in a false flag attempt to get herself noticed. Her canned quips and visionless campaign offered no policy prescriptions other than “I’m also in with Medicare for all”. Another vapid careerist climber politician. No thanks.', 'createDate': '1575399038', 'updateDate': '1577687247', 'approveDate': '1575400405', 'recommendations': 18, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103947950, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jim Muncy', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103948214', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103950524, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103950524, 'userID': 69580355, 'userDisplayName': 'Jim Muncy', 'userLocation': 'Florida', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/pimage.timespeople.nytimes.com/avatars/cropped-052097760c853394d6a6fe5d2c9d772ddd20327140c0b36db0f4a7ed1ba687f8.jpg', 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': "@Levon 

1. I'm a Bernie bro, so I must like lectures. Things are not okay; she's got to communicate that fact in a stern parental tone, not in Mr. Rogers' voice.
2.They have to go after Trump. It's politics. And he is a serious threat to democracy. (Wish he were just the average selfish Republican.)
3. Biden has some political baggage that needs to be pointed out. Somebody had to speak out; apparently no one else wanted the burden.
4. All of them have speechwriters and aides giving them one-liners.
5. M4All is probably D.O.A. anyway, but at least she's for it. (We need universal healthcare.)
6. Yes, it is her career; and most of them want to be president. Many of us do or did.
7. Granted, she's not FDR, but Bernie might be.

But thanks for your comments. They do sting and bring up some embarrassing points and issues; we all have shortcomings. She, like the others, is a fallible human being, but a cut, I think, well above the average politician, which is miles above the disastrous incumbent in the White House.

In fact, I would like to know who you recommend. (I could live with any of them.)", 'createDate': '1575404626', 'updateDate': '1577687302', 'approveDate': '1575406789', 'recommendations': 8, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103948214, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jim Muncy', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103950524', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103954756, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103954756, 'userID': 34456491, 'userDisplayName': 'Levon', 'userLocation': 'Left Coast', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': '@Jim Muncy  thank you Jim for your thoughts and civility.

I too, “was” a Bernie Bro in 2016, but as it pains me to say it, he may well be past his prime.

You’re right, things are far from okay, but everyone paying attention knows what kind of individual DJT was before the 2016 election, and Secretary Clinton still lost to that. And he’s only going to get worse. Repeating how awful the president and his minions are, isn’t policy, isn’t inspiring and gets repetitive and old real quick.

Bidens baggage wasn’t bussing as it turns out, but his establishmentarian outlook, and reputation-reliance on his eight years as Obama’s veep. I see little else that he rings to the table and the political savanna has changed, and I see him as the gazelle with a broken leg.

Living in San Francisco, I see Harris as I do Gavin Newsom, political windsocks continuously eyeing their next runs, having too little too show for their time spent in their previous jobs. 

Knowing when not to say those one-liners is a measure of temperament,  as is who one hires to be the campaign manager. I like Buttigieg’s thoughtfulness and ability to self reflect; but his climb will be steep. 

I too could live with any of them, but temper and cadence and policy count. One could be all in for any number of ideas, but also need to be grounded and reality based.', 'createDate': '1575418085', 'updateDate': '1577687393', 'approveDate': '1575421080', 'recommendations': 3, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103950524, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Jim Muncy', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103954756', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: A lot of people condemned her for being a forthright prosecutor and attorney general in CA but I saw that experience as valuable in dealing with hardliners and males who overwhelm our government.  I think any female candidate for president is going to have difficulty not only beating Trump but winning over the male voter.  Most American men are not there yet.  As an African American woman, I am proud that Kamala Harris has increased her visibility and asked the tough questions at Congressional hearings.

commentBody: This was wholly predictable.  She was vapid and stood for nothing.  She would do and say anything for a crumb of an advantage - even sacrificing her dignity.  Good riddance.

commentBody:
Thank you, Senator Harris, for your work on behalf of our democracy.

You are an excellent senator and much needed in the Senate these days.

commentBody:
She has already made a deal with Elizabeth. Women Know how to work together this time. A hard black politician, with an agenda. Men have no clue what is about to hit them.
1920 2020 19 amendment
I am glad to live in this time!!!
Her prosecutorial record was borderline criminal. Hiding evidence that could have exonerated defendants in order to get that win is disgusting and immoral.
Vacuity is hard to overcome.

Proof positive that Democrats are out to left field when they claim they want diversity and inclusivity in the WH.

She checked all the boxes, exactly what the Liberals have been clamoring they want - woman, minority, liberal, leftist, and more. Inclusivity, feminist, minority, I mean she had all the adjectives that you guys have been clamoring for years that you wanted as a leader.

Yet you did not support her.

Instead you support white, old, millionaire, Washington Insiders, career politicos, the same creatures you claim to despise. Those get the polls, donations and adoring crowds.

Could it be that all along you were just blowing up smoke while privately backing just more of the same usual candidates?

So much for the Liberal wave. Major Pete take note, you're next.

commentBody:
Good riddance Kamala!

She sold out in a settlement to Wall Street investors when AG of California, leaving middle class taxpayers like me to shoulder the financial fallout of the crisis.

Her political ambitions far outpace her convictions and qualifications.
Her humorless snarl when attacking her opponents will not be missed—and should be a lesson to other politicians.

Good riddance to Ms. Harris. Her conduct as a senator has been deplorable. Her attack on Biden and busing was mean and absurd. Times are different. You may not love Biden, but he is not a bigot. She is nasty at hearings, treating people such as Justice Kavanagh with tremendous disrespect. Regardless of the facts, one does not treat a federal appellate judge as if he were a criminal that she was prosecuting.  I also loved her blurting out about LGBTQ people when the debates turned to health care- just yell a catch phrase- that's what a president ought to do!

She was another Donald Trump.

commentBody:
Great Senator, poor campaigner.
Stay in the Senate and do great things there, Kamala!

"Catastrophic", Leah Greenberg? Really?? Color and gender requirements still mandatory by democrats? Only difference is dems have moved from "must be White Male" to "must be "Women of Color"? We democrats are in a boat of trouble and making it easier for the demagogue trump to be re-elected. What happened to Presidential Qualifications regardless of race and gender and wealth?
Sadder yet hopefully wiser, she now has the opportunity to become even more effective than she ever had been before.
Why liberals hate an idea of strong woman of color running for presidency so much? Where is promised liberal diversity and inclusiveness community organizer begged them to adopt?

I voted for Senator Harris.  This, despited being deeply disappointed in her track record on the environment as AG.  To be honest, as a constituent, it would be nice to see our Freshman Senator spend some time focusing on the needs of Californians in lieu of leading rallies in Iowa.  I wonder how many other voters in California feel the same way...

She was never inspiring like Obama.  Her town hall gatherings lacked substance; she seemed to be focusing on sound bites.  Her Medicare for All plan took 10 years.   She doesn't have the experience of Joe Biden or any accomplishments to speak of.  I was turned off by her calculated attack vs. him. Candidates rarely resonate with voters for long after they attack other candidates. Corey Booker is more appealing to me and he was able to make critical points without grandstanding.  I also have problems with commentators anointing candidates because they fit some profile.  I would prefer candidates who are not from Calif, NY or Mass (where I live) but who represent other parts of our country like the mid West or Montana.  And who don't just latch onto impractical liberal ideas that poll well for awhile.  If she was more of a visionary and a better communicator, she would still be in the race.  I know others like Yang and Gabbard and NY or CA billionaires are even less appealing and have even less experience.  Harris can learn from this experience. But she is no Obama.   Other people of color like Colin Powell or Elijah Cummings would have made great presidents.  I'm sorry they didn't get a chance.  And Michelle Obama would win in a heartbeat.

Harris, as well as others, were posturing and using language out of what felt like an 1980’s political playbook — it lacks authenticity.

Though Warren and Sanders come off as far more genuine, they are too far left.  Buttigieg however seems both authentic and more moderate — and considering where we are as a country, a moderate can do a better job at uniting the country. 

Having an extreme progressive as president will only deepen the divide, and we cannot afford that as a country. 

Harris was not an extreme progressive (a huge plus) but lacking authenticity and a clear vision was her undoing — no one did this to her.

Sad to see her go. A real fighter with a foot in the real world. Anyone who has been in this thing we call life a bit knows no one is perfect. If you think someone is your a youth in early stages of love or in a cult.  We don’t need gurus or Priests.
Hope someone is doing a financial update on  donations made to her campaign  from outside sources?

She didn’t serve six months in the senate before she thought she was qualified to be president. 

We haven’t seen arrogance like that since 2008. 

That was the year another unqualified candidate simply got lucky when the opposing party ran a slightly more arrogant, rather senile candidate, with a joke for a running mate, who thought it was his birthright to be president. The ensuing eight years lead us to where we are today.

Harris wasn’t so lucky, though we’re clearly better off.
I find Kamala Harris's removal from the running a great surprise. I thought for sure she was the most likely contender. But I must say this news is a great relief.
Wouldn't she be a great Attorneys General if the Democrats win?  Or Supreme Court?  My hope is that she will be able to realize her fabulous potential.
KH was out of her depth. She lost me with her calculating but temporary race-based takedown of JB, and this is a very welcome winnowing of a still unmanageable field of candidates.
Harris still is in the fight.  Her ambition has no limit.  I believe Harris believes in herself and will accomplish great things in the furtherance of her career.
Perhaps we’ll see her again as Attorney General or VP?
While I was looking forward to all the free stuff, she just didn't make sense as president.

Senator Harris was not in the 2020 race. She, like a lot of the "candidates" were and are really running for 2024. A shame her campaign supporters didn't get the joke.

At least President Obama just made a great speech at the  year's nominating convention four years previous.
It’s a shame, she’s a much better candidate than the majority of the people still in the race.

commentBody:
Yep. that's exactly what the Democrats need, "...a barrier-breaking candidate" who will get trashed the DT before the Fourth of July fireworks have cooled.
A woman who seems incapable of committing to anything, other than her ambition, and then defining a process to reify that commitment, is such a breath of fresh air in an election bogging down in Elizabeth Warren's encyclopedia of facts.
But, most importantly, is the often overlooked capacity to create a personal ecosystem; a group of associates who work in concert to carry out a single, well defined program.
The kind of thing that is MIA in the Trump administration and necessary in the next presidency to undo his damage to pretty much everything.
But, take heart. She is "...still very much in this fight", so we can look forward to her continuous, fatuous sniping at real candidates, further strengthening DT's re-election chances.
Atta girl, "My way or MAGA".

I bet Bloomberg approaches Kamala or maybe Biden or Warren .
She is a wise woman. 
Being the first black woman VP would suffice as long as we get trump and his RICO freedom caucus out definitively. And in prison.

Above all, Kamala Harris is Kamala Harris.  She may be a black woman, she may have an admirable agenda, she may have been a palatable prosecutor, and she may be likable.  But Kamala Harris is a lightweight at a time when we need a heavyweight.
Should have dropped out long time ago....
Yang is going to win.
Now I want her back.   VP perhaps?

While many extol this ex-candidate, her divisiveness on the question of race and and her lack of a clear message were her downfall. She lost me when she attacked Biden on busing in the debates, beginning with words, "I don't think you are a racist"--said to the vice president of the first African American president of the U.S.  I really came to dislike her, and that was not my sentiment from the beginning. I am from California, and I don't think that I would want to have her continue as senator.  Opportunistic and shallow.

I would have thought more of Kamala Harris if she had done what I had hoped Michelle and Barack Obama would do once he was President emeritus.

I had written here several times that the Conversation on Race that Charles Blow hoped to see undertaken would begin with a statement by the Obamas that I here have coming from Kamala Harris.

I, Kamala Harris, want all Americans to understand that I will not let the United States government (US Census Bureau) tell me what "race" I belong to.

I will instead tell you myself that I belong to the only genetically distinguishable race, the human. My genome is 99% like yours, but thanks to my lines of descent that go start back with my mother born in India and my father born in Jamaica I have a genome containing information from them and their forebears.

I happened recently to learn of Times Magazine columnist Thomas Chatterton William's new book, Self Portrait In Black and White - Unlearning Race and perhaps he and I can discuss how Americans might benefit from unlearning race.

Only-NeverInSweden.blogspot.com
Citizen US SE

This is amazing.
You say: " feature no candidates who aren’t white." and in the next sentence you mention MLK jr who famously had a dream that the candidates would be judged not by the color of their skin.
Cognitive dissonance at it`s finest.

The two photographs speak the same story that photographs of him have spoken if studied by anyone outside of America. Neither Kamala Harris nor TCW are "seen as black" outside of America.

The thought you present confirms that a person has to live outside the USA to be able to see people for who they are, not for what color their skin is.

commentBody: “The California senator broke barriers but ran out of money as she struggled in polls.”   Broke barriers?   Which barriers??
Kamala Harris never really wanted to be president.  Harris was probably angling to  be the  attorney general in the next Democratic administration.

“No matter your candidate, you have to recognize that going from the most diverse field ever in January to a potentially all-white debate stage in December is catastrophic,” wrote Leah Greenberg, a co-executive director of Indivisible."

That's a pretty racist thing to say.  I dont want a non-white candidate simply because they are non-white, I just want the BEST candidate.  Period.  End of discussion.  

Its statements and beliefs like this that are racist in and if themselves and continue to perpetuate racism in this country.  Harris was clearly not even close to being the best candidate.  To play the race card in this situation is disgraceful and just blatantly wrong.  

Want to end racism?  Stop playing the race card night and day.  It's becoming the story of the boy who cried wolf.  Play it when it's not true and after a while no one believes you anymore.
Was never in fight, and thank you for giving up.

Though it seems like a failure to drop out, she has succeeded in helping to make it normal for women of any race to run for US President. Girls can think “someday maybe me”. The day will come and half the population will be able to contribute their talent.

She should have been proud of her get-tough record as California Attorney General instead of running from it. This set the tone for degrees of falseness and hollowness in the K.H. campaign. I’m not sure if these kinds of mistakes can be overcome, but if she has any further endeavors for higher office, she must step back and go and do some real, solid and deep soul searching, distilling her essence down to her real essence; if she did this, I believe that she would “see” and “know” and “understand” that, while racism exists in our country, every white person who disagrees with her or her positions is not a racist.  Obama could not have been elected without the white people who voted for him. Harris is not an Obama, not even close.  He knew — and knows — things Harris has yet to grasp. I hope one day she will.

I never liked Harris as a candidate.  She was too fake and tried too hard.  She just wanted to add president to her resume.  The way she went after Tulsi and even Biden was disgraceful.  She was trying to hard to get a soundbite for a campaign ad.

Also, too many people are on the debate stage.  Thank goodness one more is gone.  Now we need to get rid of Booker, Castro, and Klobuchar.

Only downside is no more Maya Rudolph.  The funt has dropped out.  I wonder if she will now get her TNT show.
The field has to narrow - and soon. But Kamala is far more qualified and skilled than Buttigieg. Frustrating.

Sleeping with older people for cushy, publicly funded, positions is not a qualification for anything.", 'createDate': '1575463380', 'updateDate': '1575605368', 'approveDate': '1575464676', 'recommendations': 2, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103957692, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'JL', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103960052', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
Despite the efforts of Chris Mathews and Chuck Todd, who had Harris on their programs practically every week (no Sanders or Warren!! -- she revealed herself as another establishment candidate.

Of course, there was an important difference between Kamala Harris and Hillary Clinton.

Clinton called for severe prosecutions of black youth,  but 
 Harris actually carried out the prosecutions.

Her Rise in the polls, for some, was due to her sneak attack on Joe Biden.  For me, that was the deal breaker even though I was already suspicious of her, having launched a run for the presidency while she was only a first term senator. I also lost respect for CNN's Van Jones who loved her performance, proclaiming that "a Star Was Born".  Some star.  She had nothing and is nothing. And Van Jones?  That's when I left CNN and now watch MSNBC, a much more professional team of reporters.
All former Harris supporters should get behind Amy Klobuchar! She is our best bet to win in 2020! Don't be fooled by her underdog appearance.

With fewer than three years in the Senate and what was, a troubled tenure as California AG, Harris's candidacy was founded from the start not on her qualifications but on identity politics.

We were supposed to like her because she is a woman of color. She was supposed to do well in South Carolina because she is Black, sort of, and Biden is white.

Who cares? Apparently not that many voters.

Campaign mismanagement.   Maya Harris just does not have the experience, the political aptitude & the managerial chops to run a major national campaign. National campaigns must make fast, informed, intelligent decisions...Most caimpaign decisions were bogged down by candidate's sister, Maya Harris.  Campaign decisions made slowly or not at all. The campaign had "paralysis/analysis".  Even the official campaign manager was cautious & careful not to cross & deferred to Maya Harris. Campaign decisions to waste resources on non essential areas like an expensive, non essential Baltimore campaign Headquarters an example of bad decisions that spread the Harris campaign way too thin.  The Harris campaign did not get independent campaign finance sources going until it was ready to implode. Senator Harris did not adequately tap her rich, high value California home base of donors that are essential Dems victory in 2020. Senator Harris represents 40M CA voters in the largest, richest state?!  Kamala Harris is a proven vote getter with progressives, Dems, moderates and Repubs. It is hard to believe that Senator Harris could not get better traction among Democrats.
Campaign mismanagement: Kamala Harris was not defined for voters.  The Campaign did not adopt clear issues & practical solutions to issues 
 for primary voters.  Debates: Harris's inadequate, late response to Gabbard's fake fox right wing talking points attacking her record as CA AG let the wind out of her campaign's sails.

Thank you for the article and thank you Senator Harris,  for your attempt to lead our country in 2020 (technically 2021). Just one major correction: Shirley Chisholm is the first African American woman to run for the US Presidential bid from a major political party. This was in 1972 and mirrors Senator Biden’s gaffe about Carol Mosley Braun being the only African American Female Senator. Until we teach both culturally relevant history on a historic and current level in schools that includes the amazing contributions of people of African descent as AMERICANS, we will continue to have these disheartening mistakes in all forms of media.
There was never much about her approach that could be taken seriously by most Americans.

One of my favorites in the race for the Democratic Presidential Nomination is gone ...
But I am not particularly upset.
There remain a couple of wonderful candidates who are electable.
There remain candidates I consider  both acceptable and electable.
And there are at least 12 who are neither, in my personal opinion, and should quit the race, for all they do is attack better candidates and waste resources.
But then again, I tend to support members of no organized political party- I tend to support Democrats.
It is time for the candidates to recognize reality that there is only place for one name on the ballot.
Those of similar minds should sit down and discuss which of their colleagues has the best chance, and get behind that person.
That would leave us with three or four strong choices - experienced, skilled and better than either than the incumbent or any likely GOP candidate if he withdraws; is unable to run following removal from office - a step I am sure would be followed by multiple indictments, whatever.
With three or four in the race, we could start talking issues, rather than physical appearance, charm, or the horse race concept do damaging to politics.
Within a few months, we might be down to two, with two different visions for repairing the damage the nation has suffered since 2016 under the rule of a tyrant who would be absolute ruler.
Maybe a new candidate might be proposed, a superior leader who just has been too busy helping in the trenches.
That could be best.

I’m a democrat, and I voted for KH for Senate.  But the more I learned about her the more I realized she is not a leader.  From vacillations on MFA and weed, it’s clear she doesn’t know what she stands for and totally lacks vision.  I hope someone runs against her in 2022 and she loses her seat.  Maya Rudolph’s impression of her is spot on; we don’t need someone like that representing the greatest state in the Union.

Congratulations and thanks for yur effortsfor probity and eloqquence, Senator Harris.This makes possible  the resumption ofera full court press  in the US Senate. and to continue in alliance with other candidates and other Demo Party leadership to get ready for taking change of the Executive Branch in January 2021. And think of what a fine collection of talent She and others (both those still in the campaign and other Party leadership) for key posts in the Executive Branch (the Cabinet, etc,)beginning in January 2021 !

Harris attacked Biden on race and busing in the first debate. I don't think Biden would consider Harris. She has minimal Washington experience and was destroyed by Gabbard in one debate. Harris was not going to be the nominee and she finally accepted that fact. Now she can focus on being a senator and retain her senate seat in 2022, in California, a state full of wealthy and talented Democrats.
There was such a different Kamala with each debate, it definitely kept me guessing as to what she actually believed. Or maybe she never really firmly believed in anything in the first place?

I have yet to decide who I am supporting but find myself depressed by the aging, white candidates. And while I find Buttigieg interesting, capable, smart (and may ultimately vote for him), it’s sad that a very accomplished woman just can’t gain the same traction.

commentBody:
Imagine that, a candidate that acknowledges their financial limitations and chooses not to go into debt. Now that is an example of prudence. 
Those candidates who ran for President when the United States was first formed didn't need millions of dollars to pay for those TV and online 'attack and defend ads' that we have now. 
Isn't it about time we leveled the 'playing field' and have campaign donations come solely from private donations of citizens, and put a 'cap' on the donations of a price that is no more than $50?! 
Also, a candidate that has experience working as a prosecutor who designed progressive programs for those who were jailed and prosecuted environmental polluting companies successfully is someone who has skills to heal divisions between divisions that exist and someone uniquely qualified for these times. 
The fact that she shifted her position from Medicare for all to a stance that speaks to what a majority of American's want is smart.  People who are thinking want a candidate who can think things through and who has the courage to change their position. This is being an emergent leader. 
She is a smart, experienced leader who has demonstrated her ability to improve the status quo. Sorry to see her step down. We need candidates that are fresh, genuine, willing to work with a majority of Americans and who really care. Kamala is such a candidate.

commentBody: Thank goodness Harris bowed out. Maybe in a Biden Presidency, he might appoint Harris to be the US AG, who should unearth and air all of the corruptions under the trump administration, including barr's abuse of power and corruptions.
Kamala’s attack on biden about busing was fair game. He needed to answer for his actions in the 70s and she had every reason to feel offended and ask for an apology.
replies:
[{'commentID': 103958879, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103958879, 'userID': 78261382, 'userDisplayName': 'GANDER-FIR', 'userLocation': 'NY', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': "@observer 
KH attack on Biden reeked of hypocrisy and rang hollow  since it turned out her position on Bussing was no different  from Biden.
It wasn't some genuine and heartfelt statement but a craven act of political expediency.
And it backfired ,rightly so I must add since it exposed KH for the conniving  and craven politico without a moral core that she is.", 'createDate': '1575451132', 'updateDate': '1575461637', 'approveDate': '1575456102', 'recommendations': 1, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103957747, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'observer', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103958879', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: It’s heartening to see so many commenters cite her cheap, calculated and inflammatory attack on Biden as a disqualifying strike against her candidacy. I’m glad to know that in times when it seems the only thing valued is winning, many of us still stand steadfastly with character, which people - Harris included - reveal with their actions.

Deeply disappointing that Kamala had to pull out. I looked forward to voting for her in the california primary.Now i am disinterested and do not know if i will vote in the primary.  Her decline started with a pointless attack during a debate from tulsi gabbard, another brown woman candidate who has no chance of getting the nomination and has been all over the place attacking her own party and voicing gop policies. Why did she bother to run? Maybe she is betting on s position in s biden government. By the end of all of it two brown women have  brought each other down to pete’s and amy’s advantage and accomplished nothing else.There were traitors in kamala’s campaign trying to cover their own failures as well, and a white media judging her second debate performance unfairly. 
California voters are enlightened. Not so national voters and it is why kamala lost. America is not ready for a brown president and a woman president is also in serious doubt, Bobby jindal had no votes in 2016 and never had a chance of getting my vote and I dont see myself ever voting for nikki haley either. I did not vote in 2016 though i did in 2018. If i vote in 2020 it will be for anybody but trump. The democratic party candidatevwill win in california anyway in november 2020

Good for her. It is important to be wise and know when it is time to quit. Other candidates should do the same. The stage is too crowded. Be wise, retire and let 3 or 4 push on. You're doing a service to the party knowing when to step aside.

commentBody:
Harris was not my first choice, but I'm sorry to see her go.
We need her and everyone in this fight..
I admire this woman for having the good sense and the concern for the Democratic Party to take this step

Ran out of money? OK, well, who among us hasn't faced tough economic times? 
Simply reduce one's spending! 
I'm certainly no fan of Ms. Harris, but it seems to me that if one is having difficulty managing a campaign and its related budget, trying to manage a whole country is way beyond one's skill set. 
With free social media and clever use of news sources, an effective campaign could be run on very little money. Let the billionaire boys waste their money on expensive ads. They aren't necessary.

Kamala is obviously smart and competent ... but seemed to lack principles ... early on she could not decide if she wanted medicare for all or Obamacare plus ... how could she run for President without established ideas on healthcare ?  I don’t think healthcare mattered to much to her ... she appeared disconnected from that very important issue ..people caught on to that ...

Harris tried, just didn’t catch on.  Yes, she would be a competent Vice President but would not help either Biden or Mayor Pete get elected.  Getting elected is Priority One!
My favorites are Susan Rice or my dream pick: Michelle Obama.  Yes, I know Michelle Obama has said she isn’t interested, but when it comes down to it, you never know...
This is good. A candidate who could not conceive of a strategy would probably not make a great world leader.
It is too bad that the money wasn’t there to keep her going. She has much to offer.

Know who NEEDS Her as a VP running mate ?  Warren.  Think about it.
   Seriously.

commentBody:
I love Kamala Harris. I watched with admiration as she announced her candidacy, as I have virtually every time I've seen her including several Senate hearings. I considered her in my top 3 or 4 this year and I'm very sorry to see her end her campaign.

She broke my heart when she made that broadside on Joe Biden. It seemed contrived and abridged; when she arrived at the tag line "that little girl was me" I could hear the meme writing itself.

We claim to understand different times call for different social and political approaches and yet we attack people decades after the fact for taking the approaches those times call for.

And attacking someone for something she could not explain her own shifting position on, a couple decades later, in a more progressive community as a person of color herself, seemed almost to come from the Republican playbook.

My senator, Cory Booker, who I also love, disheartened me with similar confrontations of Biden but I credit him for subsequent statements repudiating that approach.

I've lost respect for Julian Castro for a particularly sneering and taunting attack that was more hasty and baseless than any I can remember in a Democratic primary, seeming to accuse Biden of senility when it was Castro who couldn't remember what he had heard "two minutes ago," which moderators let slide but commentators afterward pointed out.

Biden is also in my top 3 or 4 but Pete's been #1 for me because I haven't seen him take cheap and hypocritical shots.

I was all for Kamela Harris until she attacked Joe Biden.  It was unfair, unnecessary and seemed disingenuous. commentBody: The primaries exposed that she stands for nothing, and there is nothing there there aside from posturing and asking questions in a prosecutorial tone. She can expect a primary challenge when the time comes, and may not be able to hold on to her seat.

Kamala Harris would have been the best candidate to take on Trump. She could have challenged him on every issue, debated him point by point, and fully exposed him for what he really is.  At the same time, it would have been so historic to see a female minority candidate representing a major party on the world stage. Only in America, can an immigrant's daughter go this far. We have not seen the last of her, I sure hope she gets picked for VP from the eventual nominee.

I didn't find the closing line about Biden's walking away very compelling. In the linked tweet, he seems to be walking away before the question is asked. Was the NYT there? Perhaps shrewd on Biden's part. Perhaps Biden didn't hear the question. 

In any case, how pleasant to hear former competitors speak kindly of Sen. Harris. Even if it's political theater, I appreciate it. (I didn't expect to value kindness so much among presidental candidates, but it seems necessary to list it explicitly these days.)

When she was among the top four, I stunned friends by saying that, if those were the four making it to Michigan, I'd vote for Harris.  She's very good.  She seems a little immature for her age.  I hope that changes.  Meanwhile, I hope our next President is wise enough to enlist her in their battle to help this country recover/move on from the ravages of (hopefully just) four years of the worst leadership and decision making since Harding, if not ever.
Senator Harris will make a fine AG who will waste no time in nailing Trump and his criminal enterprise to the wall in 2021.  God Speed.
Was she ever really in ?

Senator Harris' biggest problem was.....Senator Harris.  Like Kirsten Gillibrand, a flip flopping opportunist...........and the voters saw it. 

Her attempted take down of Joe Biden because he remembered being able to work with segregationists on legislature was pure virtual signaling and uncalled for.

Good riddance.  

Maybe we will nominate someone who can defeat Trump, not just prance around the virtue signaling stage.

When one door closes another opens...at least for some. Ms Harris has a bright future. She is young and can run again in 2024 or 2028. She will, hopefully, represent California well. She'll make an excellent Veep or an Attorney  General. She's also much needed in the Senate.
I’m thinking Kamala Harris would make a spectacular US Attorney General.
Why is this a surprise? Her attacks on Biden and disgraceful, uncouth behavior during the Kavanaugh hearings revealed the kind of person she is. Happy to see her go.

A talented brilliant woman who will continue to serve her country well, no matter what. She will remain a strong voice for our democracy. But we cannot assume that race and gender played a part in the lack of support she received as a candidate. The over-arching issue for Democrats is to defeat Trump in 2020, should he make it that far. That’s what Dems are laser-focused on. Those who remain as candidates are there because voters believe they can beat Trump. Don’t weaken the party by turning this into an internal race/gender debate. It’s not about that. It’s about defeating Trump.

scorched earth lines via twitter and imperson and what else?

incredible emptiness and empathy.

not a presidential candidate, by far.

I like her just fine as my Senator, but as my POTUS? Nope. I don't think it's anything she did during her campaign particularly, it's just that she's just sort of unlikable on a grander stage. VP? Oh, heck to the NO. She's a safe bet for a Cabinet post as her seat in Congress will, with 99.9% certainly, remain with the Democrats.

So, her departure raises the prospect that all democrats running in December are white.  And your point is, what?   That this is “catastrophic”?  Why?    Welcome to politics and the political system that has made this country what is for almost 300 years.
